Class DataReader

java.lang.Object
DataReader
public class DataReader extends Object
DataReader class for the Prediction Team Module Reads, validates, calculates income and expenses, compares calculations, and summarizes report.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    DataReader()
    Default constructor for the DataReader class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    double
    calculateTotalExpenses()
    Calculates the total expenses by summing fixed, variable, and other expenses.
    double
    calculateTotalIncome()
    Calculates the total income by adding up all sources of income such as salary, wages, bonuses, tips, and other money received (e.g., alimony, child support, or government benefits like unemployment or Social Security).
    boolean
    compareIncomeVsExpenses(double totalIncome, double totalExpenses)
    Compares the total income and total expenses to determine if there is a surplus.

  • Constructor Details

    • DataReader

      public DataReader()
      Default constructor for the DataReader class. Initializes the object without any parameters. * @author Jessica Barrera Saguay

  • Method Details

    • readData

      public void readData()
      Reads stored budget data from the file provided. This method does not return a value but prepares the data for further processing.

    • isDataValid

      public boolean isDataValid()
      Validates that the data in the file is correct and has no missing information.
      Returns:
      true if the data is valid, false otherwise

    • calculateTotalIncome

      public double calculateTotalIncome()
      Calculates the total income by adding up all sources of income such as salary, wages, bonuses, tips, and other money received (e.g., alimony, child support, or government benefits like unemployment or Social Security).
      Returns:
      the sum of all income sources

    • calculateTotalExpenses

      public double calculateTotalExpenses()
      Calculates the total expenses by summing fixed, variable, and other expenses.
      Returns:
      the total amount of all expenses combined

    • compareIncomeVsExpenses

      public boolean compareIncomeVsExpenses(double totalIncome, double totalExpenses)
      Compares the total income and total expenses to determine if there is a surplus.
      Parameters:
      totalIncome - the total income calculated from all sources
      totalExpenses - the total amount of all expenses
      Returns:
      the code will return true if the total income is greater than the total expenses, but false otherwise

    • createSummaryReport

      public void createSummaryReport()
      Creates and displays a summary report using the calculated income and expense data. The report may include totals and indicate whether there is a surplus or deficit.
